confession.seduction_context: Soldiers billetted on him had stolen a horse and beaten him; pursued them to Merviller, but could not recover the horse. Napnel met him on way back as he was lamenting, and gave him money for another horse to seduce him - turned into oak leaves.
powder_types: grey powder to kill men and animals

testimony.quarrel_subject: Seigaire had been boasting of how he had arranged for troops to be billetted on neighbours. Witness suggested this was not exact truth.
Bought house near that of Seigaire for 400 francs, bidding against him at auction. Daughter-in-law of accused came to ask him to cede the house, offering him 3 resaulx of wheat or more. He refused.

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Seigaire
notable_quotes.context: 24 years earlier, when returning from Ramberviller at night with companions, a wind suddenly surrounded them and they heard something fall in the woods. Seigaire called out this phrase.

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Seigaire
notable_quotes.french: que pour l'advenir, il ne se soucioit plus ou diable que on le menne, ny qu'on fasse de luy, et qu'on ne luy scauroit plus faire de mal qu'il avoit
notable_quotes.english: that for the future, he did not care where the devil took him, nor what was done to him, and that no more harm could be done to him than he had already suffered
notable_quotes.context: Said on the same occasion when returning from Ramberviller, according to witness Nicolas Moullot

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Regnauldin (witness 5)
notable_quotes.context: 6 years before had been next to accused at Mass, and instead of saying prayers to God he said nothing but 'des Colliques' throughout service. Witness told his father, who told him never to speak of it.

historical_context.military_details: Previous October troops had been passing on way to Juliers, and accused had been supposed to house 11 but avoided this. 24 years earlier, when Bouillon's army was passing, the witness, Colas Moullot of la Bourgonce, and the accused were sent to buy arms at Ramberviller. Soldiers billetted on accused had stolen a horse and beaten him.

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial shows extensive prior accusations dating back to 1599 (12 years before execution). Accused confessed without torture after being confronted by multiple previously convicted witches. Notable for military context (troops to Juliers, Bouillon's army) and economic disputes (house auction, billeting). Reputation mentioned by witnesses ranges from 20-36 years. Change de Nancy approved sentence.
